Package ooga.view.board

Class Board

java.lang.Object
javafx.scene.Node
javafx.scene.Parent
javafx.scene.layout.Region
javafx.scene.layout.Pane
javafx.scene.layout.GridPane
ooga.view.board.Board
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget
public class Board
extends javafx.scene.layout.GridPane
Purpose: a visual representation of the board. Assumptions: that one calls createBoard shortly after it is made, or other methods will fail. Dependencies: extends GridPane and uses Tiles. An Example: Board board = new Board; createBoard(8,8);

  • Property Summary

  • Method Details

    • createBoard

      public void createBoard​(int width, int height)
      Purpose: to create a board of a specific width and height. Assumptions: must be called shortly after construction, assumes width and height are 1-26.
      Parameters:
      width - : the width of the board
      height - : the height of the board

    • makeGrid

      private void makeGrid​(int width, int height)
      Creates the grid structure of the board, styling with patterns.

    • colorGrid

      private void colorGrid​(javafx.scene.paint.Color firstColor, javafx.scene.paint.Color secondColor)

    • colorLightSquares

      public void colorLightSquares​(javafx.scene.paint.Color color)
      Purpose: to color all the light colored squares a specific color. Assumptions: assumes valid color Parameters (purpose beyond their name if necessary)
      Parameters:
      color - the new color of the light tiled squares.

    • colorDarkSquares

      public void colorDarkSquares​(javafx.scene.paint.Color color)
      Purpose: to color all the dark colored squares a specific color. Assumptions: assumes valid color
      Parameters:
      color - the new color of the dark tiled squares.

    • movePiece

      public void movePiece​(int startX, int startY, int endX, int endY)
      Moves a piece from one coordinate on a board to another. This method assumes that the move is valid.
      Parameters:
      startX - starting x coordinate
      startY - starting y coordinate
      endX - ending x coordinate
      endY - ending y coordinate

    • showPossibleMoves

      public void showPossibleMoves​(java.util.Iterator<javafx.util.Pair<java.lang.Integer,​java.lang.Integer>> possibleMoves)
      Highlights all possible spaces a clicked piece can move to.
      Parameters:
      possibleMoves - an Iterator of Pair objects of 2 integers

    • unhighlightAll

      public void unhighlightAll()
      Unhighlights all Tile on the board

    • highlightTile

      public void highlightTile​(int x, int y)
      Highlights a single Tile on the board, specified by x and y coordinate.
      Parameters:
      x - x coordinate of tile
      y - y coordinate of tile

    • setHighlightColor

      public void setHighlightColor​(javafx.scene.paint.Color color)
      Purpose: to set the highlight color of the squares. Assumptions: assumes valid color
      Parameters:
      color - : the value that instance variable myHighlightColor is being set to

    • removePiece

      public javafx.scene.image.ImageView removePiece​(int x, int y)
      Removes a game piece from the board. This works similar to a pop() method and will return the piece that was just removed.
      Parameters:
      x - x coordinate of piece
      y - y coordinate of piece
      Returns:
      the ImageView of the piece that was just removed.

    • spaceIsEmpty

      public boolean spaceIsEmpty​(int x, int y)
      Determines whether the queried tile is empty.
      Parameters:
      x - x coordinate
      y - y coordinate
      Returns:
      a boolean

    • createTile

      private Tile createTile​(int i, int j)

    • addPiece

      public void addPiece​(int x, int y, java.lang.String color, java.lang.String fileName)
      Purpose: to add a piece at a certain location Assumptions: valid paramaters
      Parameters:
      x - : the x position of the piece
      y - : the y position of the piece
      color - : the team/color of the piece
      fileName - : the type of piece it is
